name: BEST WESTERN Plus Station House Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great facility. Easy walking distance to Lake Tahoe and Casinos. Excellent Breakfast. Staff is fantastic...friendly and very helpful. Perfect location and very reasonable rates for this area and quality of property. We always come back!
reviews.title: Best Western Station House Lake Tahoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel often to Reno and Lake Tahoe and usually stay at the big casino's hotels, but this time we decided to stay at the Best Western in Lake Tahoe which is close to the main attractions, in particular within walking distance to a private beach and within 3 blocks to the Casinos and the Gondola rides. We were very pleased with the staff and the room amenities, it was very cleaned and the décor was great. Also, we were upgraded to a King room which is larger than the queen room.. The breakfast was a plus, they offer a full breakfast menu which is included in the room price.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel so I could see the sights in South Lake Tahoe. It is well located off of the main street within walking distance of the beach at Lake Tahoe. There is a charge to get into the beach, but the hotel provides a free pass so you can avoid the charge. The room was very nice and the free breakfast was at the adjoining restaurant. I was able to get a sit down hot breakfast with waiter service. There was menu provided so you had many choices for breakfast. The hotel has internet service via Ethernet cable. It does not have Wi-Fi. I enjoyed my stay there and will stay at this hotel when I visit Lake Tahoe in the future.
reviews.title: Hotel has a nice location at South Lake Tahoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location .,, A short walk to downtown So. Lake Tahoe and the lake. Room was comfortable, restaurant was great for dinner or lunch by the pool and rate included free breakfast. We were visiting Lake Tahoe for a wedding at a private residence. We absolutely loved the downtown area ... probably will return again!
reviews.title: Lake Tahoe Wedding Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Overall experience was great, when we first arrived our room was not ready, so they upgraded us from a Queen to a king, very helpful. The hotel is very close to the beach, and comes with a free beach pass, you also get a free full coarse breakfast in the restaurant every morning! Staff and ground's keepers great! Nice pool and hot tub very clean. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Alot for your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed here twice this summer and have been very satisfied with both stays.Our usual place to stay was Best Western Timber Cove. However, comparing rates and amenities led us to change our location to the Station House Inn. Receiving a full hot breakfast from the adjacent restaurant is a plus and the location is quieter than the other Best Western where we had to listen to late night partying from the public areas. We also were impressed with the personnel including the front desk and maid service. The small refrigerator is a bonus not usually found in motels. The only negative is the small size rooms and it is not beach front like the other motel. However the rooms had everything you need, full size wardrobes, bathroom heat lamps etc. and you can easily walk to the casinos and many new shops, restaurants and the grocery store.
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Station House Inn was in a lovely location-off the main drag in S Lake Tahoe which was nice. It made evenings much quieter. It is close to the beach and a short walk to the main street area. I liked the Raley's grocery store close by as I tend to "fix" meals from shopping rather than going to a restaurant every time. Staff was pleasant and helpful at the main desk. My only complaints are I thought the room was rather small. Not really a place to set up the luggage rack and I would have liked a microwave. It did have a small refrigerator. I would definately recommend this motel and would probably stay here again if I return to the area.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Tahoe for the 4th of July this year and my sister in law booked this room for us. Very good deal for a room in Tahoe on that particular holiday weekend and we loved the doors being accessible to the outside (as opposed to my sis in laws at the Embassy Suites where she had to walk through two different corridors to get to her corner room inside the hotel). The room was very clean and comfortable, the housekeepers were fantastic and very nice ladies. The best part was breakfast, after assuming your going to get a lousy continental breakfast of cereal or do it yourself waffles, at the B/W Station House Inn, you get a full service breakfast at LewDelMars with the opportunity to be seated by the vivacious Bonnie. The private beach nearby was two maybe 1 and a half blocks away, so it was great to not have to hassle with parking at all. All in all, we were very pleasantly surprised how much nicer our hotel was than our family members stay at the Embassy!!!
reviews.title: Best location in Tahoe, near the beach/shopping and GREAT breakfast!
Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with The B/W Station House. Usually stay at the B/W Timber Cove,which we really like but decided to try the Station House as it was closer to casinos and did not want to mess with parking since we had our bikes with us. It was a great location if you want to be in town. Room was clean and comfy. Nicer bed linens, fridge, coffee maker. The FULL breakfast in the attached restaurant is a great PLUS. Nice outside dining area for lunch. Grounds well maintained. Lakeside Beach access is very nice, just a short walk. We had spent the day riding bikes and hiking and then dnner in town, definately would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was probably built in the 1970's, and hasn't seen many improvements since. The staff was friendly, but not terribly knowledgeable about attractions outside of the immediate area. The room was very, very small... it's a good thing we didn't have kids with us. It's pretty dark at night. I thought that the closer to the water, the better... but in Tahoe, the nicer places are on the main road, and close to the casinos. I suppose you get what you pay for. It does, however, have an excellent restaurant. The breakfast (included with the room) is a sit-down and order off the menu type arrangement, in a nice, cozy atmosphere.
reviews.title: Tired hotel... good restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is getting a little old, we have been staying at the Station House for many years. That said, the amazing breakfast, the location and the overall cleanliness makes up for any other doubts you might have.
reviews.title: Favorite at Tahoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Puzzled by the excellent reviews. Room definitely needed a facelift; dimly lit, noisy bathroom fan, dripping faucet in bathtub, grungy carpet. No TV station guide in room and no help from the front desk. Literature at front desk about local activities was outdated. The staff at the restaurant (where included breakfast is served) was very friendly, but on both days that we ate there the food was luke-warm and not too good. Would not stay here again.
reviews.title: mediocre at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this Best Western property for three nights during the first week of October. The king room was well equipped with a large flat screen television, and a mini-fridge. Excellent cleanliness and housekeeping. Friendly, professional and helpful staff at front desk. Absolutely wonderful FREE full cooked to order breakfast in the on-site restaurant. The waiters at the restaurant are very friendly and efficient. The food is great.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, No Weaknesses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on a very quiet street, but only a couple of blocks from the main drag with gambling, shops and many restaurants.
reviews.title: Best Western Lake Tahoe; AWESOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If I return to Lake Tahoe, this will definitely be my choice of lodging!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Best Western has been around for awhile. However, it's still in pretty good condition. The rooms aren't huge by current top notch hotel standards, but our King room was fine. The only complaint was that we could hear people in the room next to us. We enjoyed the hot tub and really enjoyed the "real" waiter served breakfast. The rate was decent and the surrounding properties seem to be all getting a bit long in the tooth. I guess the gaming business in northern Nevada is really getting hit hard by the Indian Casinos in California.
reviews.title: Oldie But Goodie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was another lovely surprise of a hotel a little tired round the edges but well kept and very clean. As I don't do well on stairs and there was no lift in this hotel they made sure I had a ground floor room, this once again was big and spacious with all the needs taken care of. It is situated between the shops and the beach so not far to walk to either. We could even park the car right outside our room. Considering there were lots of bikers staying it wasn't noisy at all. This time breakfast was in the restaurant next to the hotel and for the first time we sat at table and were served our breakfast with as much tea and coffee that you could consume, it was a lovely way to have breakfast very civilised.
reviews.title: Last hotel on this trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This Best Western is off the strip and has a "Tahoe" feel to it. The queen bed room however is very small so we decided to switch to a king bed in a larger room. The hotel has nice amenaties and "little touches" in the room that make the stay nice. The sit down made to order Breakfast at the cozy restaurant comes with the price of the room ! We really enjoyed breakfast there. There is a private beach only two blocks away and Harris and Harvey's are walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice Stay in Tahoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights. The first night we had two queensize bedrooms. The room were ok, but small. The other nights we had two kingsized rooms an they were much bigger. The rooms are very clean and the hotel is also quiet. The pool is very nice an with the pines around the pool you have also enough shadow. We ate almost every night in Restaurant, which is located near the hotel the breakfast and the dinner were amazing and the staff, especially Bonnie, were very friendly and helpfull. I can recommand this hotel for your stay in South Lake Tahoe.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in South Tahoe
Generally good
reviews.text: This was obviously a 1960's motel. It seems the last time it was refurbished was a while ago from the condition of the room furniture. The buildings are two-story walk-ups, which is a problem if you've got more than a carry-on suitcase. Cars park right up to the building, which could be a probIem if you're on the 1st floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The truth of reviews is always in the middle not the top or bottom. Five stars should mean there is no experience better, but the truth about Best Western Station House is it's a nice old motel with clean rooms and a very friendly owner in the restaurant. Is it a five stars...no. Is it a strong 3 or low 4... definitely. A nice touch was the room rate includes a full breakfast instead of the usual stale bagels.
reviews.title: Good old motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and were very pleased. First, the location - the inn is about three blocks off the main drag, so it was quiet at night. For those who want to visit the Nevada side casinos, it's a ten-minute walk. Second, the room rate included a full breakfast at their 3-diamond restaurant, meaning anything you wanted from the breakfast menu (including beverages). The slight downside was a 20 or so wait to get seated one of the mornings (only 5 minutes the other morning) but the sting of that was lessened by a very entertaining hostess. The pool is nice and has a refreshement booth nearby. The inn has a private beach (which we did not use). We gave sleep quality a 4-point rating only because we booked a room with a King bed but found the bed not much bigger than a Queen bed. All the rooms are non-smoking and our room was very clean. One thing they don't tell you is that one of the lamps is connected to an outlet controlled by a partly hidden switch by the door and at first we thought the lamp was defective.
reviews.title: Great Choice for a Lake Tahoe Staycation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This place was a lot nicer than I thought it would be for a Best Western. The staff was very friendly and made sure to greet all guests coming in and out.
reviews.title: Loved the rooms, Loved Breakfast with Bonnie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and nice. Came with free mints on your bedside table as well as a flat screen TV. Has two sinks: one inside the bathroom and outside so two people can get ready at once. Showers had good water pressure. Pool is very close to all rooms - no more than a minute walk to it from anywhere on the property.
reviews.title: lovely hotel, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: And it came with a FREE full cooked to order breakfast. I don't think I have had that anywhere else I have stayed. The food was delicious. I had the french toast and eggs and it was scrumptious. And I absolutely LOVED their hostess BONNIE!!! Quite a character and definitely puts you in a good mood for the rest of your day in Tahoe. We came to breakfast at around 9am and it was pretty packed. But they offer you free coffee while you are waiting. And Bonnie will definitely make your wait time seem shorter.
reviews.title: Great location, great accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was about my sixth stay at this motel. Every stay has been good.
reviews.title: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in South Tahoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The one glitch this time was that the DSL didn't work for me. A staff member set me up in their office.
reviews.title: Very impressed...great location and very quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast helps make staying here a bargain. The restaurant was written up as one of the top 100 in the country for breakfast. The delightful octogenarian hostess Bonnie will make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Great Location and excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel is within easy walking distance of casinos and other attractions.
reviews.title: Pretty rooms and private beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location is what attracted us...within walking distance to the lake, private beach, Heavenly village and casinos, short drive to other attractions.
reviews.title: Station House Inn Gingerbread House was Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great location, near the casinos and shops and a great place for a nice nature walk. It had everything! Our room was very nice, clean and with a comfortable bed. Even the bath towels were soft for those of us that that is important!! The "free" breakfast was wonderful. A lot of people took advantage of it but they got us in and out very quickly. The staff were all friendly and professional. Thanks to all for making our stay enjoyable!! I definitely would stay there again. My husband and I were there celebrating our 4 year anniversary.
reviews.title: A great home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room is fair, the carpet dirty. It has many stains on the carpet. However, the suite is roomy. The only turndown in this hotel is the bad customer service I received from the manager. He never smile to us and he looks irritated when i presented my AAA membership card. The way he handled my check-in process made me uncomfortable. However, the other staff who also helping me was nice and friendly. The breakfast was not too bad, however, they keep running out of food. Overall, I am not going back here, also the surrounding neighborhood of the hotel is a bad neighborhood.
reviews.title: Manager had bad customer service at front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this place was perfect. Cheaper than most hotels in the area. Not super fancy (in a good way), close to the main street, good service, nice CLEAN, NEWER LOOKING rooms. very satisfied with our stay here. We will be back. Found a great place to stay at. Plus FREE BREAKFAST. not a continental. Its a breakfast!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a room at the back of bldg 2, but had some plumbing problems several hours later. The front desk quickly took care,of the issue by upgrading us to a suite, as they couldn't get a plumber in that night.
reviews.title: Tremendous value, accommodations and service surprisingly good
Sept 2013
reviews.text: The rooms are recently upgraded with mission style furniture. The bathrooms are glaringly clean, the towels new and plentiful. The bed is excellent, percale sheets over/under light blanket; comforter wasn't needed. The heat is controlled accurately by thermostat, and is quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two night, location right on the state border, which was perfect for hopping over to Nevada to visit the casinos.
reviews.title: Could probably find better value places in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room seemed to have everything in it you could imagine, except space! The room was tiny, with a king bed, two chairs, table, desk, wardrobe all crammed into one tiny room. There was no where to put our cases because of this and there was a person's width of space either side of the bed. The wardrobe was rammed up against the sink which was positioned outside of the bathroom in a small 'alcove'. We were fooled at first regarding the size, due to the huge mirror positioned on the far wall, giving the impression of a double room. I would have happily lived with out the table and chairs just to give a bit more space in the room.
reviews.title: Good place for Heavenly ski trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Customer service was very good, however we used one of the 'safes' in reception. We were told each time we accessed the safe, we would have to sign, time and date a card held by reception and they would also countersign. This security measure was not always adopted by all staff, and there was occasions when the card was not produced. So it's worth noting that the security procedure in place is not always used correctly.
reviews.title: Loved the Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was the saving grace of this place. It was fantastic! Although it can get busy, so expect to sit in the lobby for anything up to 30 - 40 minutes before your host seats you. However she will keep you entertained whilst you're waiting!
reviews.title: Great family vacation with friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, there are a lot of places to stay in this area that are probably cheaper and have larger rooms!
reviews.title: A nice Best Western in a quiet location

aka: Best Western Plus Station House Hotel
description: Located a few blocks from recreational facilities, shopping dining and casinos, the Best Western Station House Inn in South Lake Tahoe features a complimentary full breakfast along with wedding and ski packages.
